answers.answer: To keep moving is the best things for your heart.  To me this does not sound like any heart issues.  When you exercise, do just that (exercise but do not push yourself).  If you feel strange, stop exercising and rest.  Have you had your blood sugar checked recently?  That would be a good place to start if this keeps happening.  Stress can lower the blood sugar and then a person feels weak.

question: hi kind sir,can i ask you this:sometimes i get the feeling like my bp has gone down and an ill sort of feelingand i take my bp and its normal. well i've read that this happens as a side effect of anxiety, welltoday something like that happened when i was at home exercising, well i had slight chest pain (not in the middle but more on the sides and gas and perhaps i got a bit panicky and had that feeling which lasted a second so i took my bp which was perfect and heart rate abt 100 which was ok considering i was exercising. anyhow i continued to exercise afterwards and didn't have that feeling again. do y think it was anything to do with my heart??i suffer from anxiety, hashimotos thyroiditis andmild mvp with slight mitral insufficiency which i was told was absolutely nothing to worry aboutand i've had my daughter since then with no issues.yesterday i exercised again and it didn't happen. do y think i should stop exercising andvisit a doctor?i am almost 33 with 3 children and have had a normal echo of the heart last year and normal stress test2.5 yrs ago.i climb stairs about 3/4 times a day and try to exercise most days of the week but now i'm sooooo scared.i hve no cholesterol, normal to low bp (usully around 10/6) no family history of heart disease,no diabetes plus i dont smoke or drink and i try to eat healthy.pls try to respond.
title: IS IT ANGINA?
